reviewText: There's no doubt these 4 discs on both sides are loaded with classic highlights but the discs are crammed into the box you have to pull one out to get to the one behind it risking a scratch. Only negative really is the discs aren't numbered..i have to guess which is which..
summary: Great collection for a small price but poorly packaged
Title: N/A

reviewText: As other reviewers have stated there is way too much of the talking heads segments and not enough hilites.But even with the so-called five greatest games on here you're better off buying the Edmonton Oilers 10 Greatest Games DVD box set as the two of the decent Gretzky games (the '81 50G in 39GP vs. Phil and '84 F vs. NYI Game 5) are on that as well as seven others most of which are in the Gretzky era. Plus the choice of games on this DVD are more the "significant" nature rather than actual "great" games. The Oilers DVD is unlike that at all. All the games on there are great and the choices are very solid.The NHL needs to take a page out of NFL Films and learn how to do documentaries on players and teams.
summary: complete waste of time and #99 deserves better

reviewText: If you're hockey fan, you'll love this.  This anthology follows Gretzky's development and tracks him through his retirement in NY.  The footage is awesome (much of what we have already seen) but a good addition to your collection.

reviewText: The title says it all. If you love hockey, you need to buy this set right now. This is my off season pick me up. The 20th century's greatest sports icon including full versions of several key games in his career.
summary: The Greatest of The Great One
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a nice DVD set and a very good review of 99's remarkable career.  John Davidson interviews Wayne and the conversation between the two is smooth and never seems forced.  Certain sections are introduced by Keifer Sutherland.  I can't say it's a complete look at his career (nothing on his brief stint with St. Louis) which is why I didn't give this set five stars.  With the exception of the game where Wayne scores his 802nd career goal (Vancouver's broadcast of the game is the one on here), all games are CBC telecasts.  The games are all restored and look and sound as good as they could possibly be.  You'll either like or be annoyed by the removal of a lot of the time between faceoffs of the games.  A recommended purchase for Wayne's fans and all hockey fans.
summary: A very good retrospective of The Great One
